value.title: STOP publishing your Power BI report until you do these 5 things!
value.excerpt: Your Power BI report could be slow and not functional. Publishing to Power BI may also show you your ugly baby. Patrick has you covered with 5 things to do before publishing to get that cute baby!  Power BI Tips: External tools https://powerbi.tips/2020/08/hot-swap-report-connections-external-tools/

value.title: Using Images from a Database in Power BI
value.excerpt: We've looked at images from sources like OneDrive and the web with your Power BI reports. What about from a database? Is that possible? Patrick takes a look at how you can do it.  SQLJason Blog:  http://sqljason.com/2018/01/embedding-images-in-power-bi-using-base64.html  Gerhard's Blog: https://blog.gbrueckl.at/2018/01/storing-images-powerbi-analysis-services-data-models/

value.title: Get the Day of the Week Name and Number in Power BI Using DAX
value.excerpt: If you don't have a date table with a column that represents the day of the week name (Saturday, Sunday, Monday etc) or number (from zero to six, or from one to seven), and you just have a date field, which you want to quickly get the day name of the week, here is a quick trick for you. Read my blog

value.title: Multi select slicer in Power BI
value.excerpt: This is a very short, simple video about how to have a multi-select slicer in Power BI. Power BI slicer is in fact multi-select by default, however, there is a very small option that if you set it, makes it even easier to use, let‚Äôs talk about it. read my article about this here: https://radacad.com/multi-select-slicer-in-power-bi

value.title: Page Level Security workaround in Power BI
value.excerpt: If you want to control the access to the Power BI report pages (or tabs) in a way that some users see some pages, and some others see other pages, we need something called page-level security. However, Power BI, as of today, doesn‚Äôt support visual-level or page-level security. There is a workaround to

value.excerpt: Power BI can get data from Google Sheet now. This functionality is released just yesterday and announced in both Power BI and Power Query blogs. value.title: Clean, transform, and load data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Power Query has an incredible amount of features that are dedicated to helping you clean and prepare your data for analysis. You will learn how to simplify a complicated model, change data types, rename objects, and pivot data. You will also learn how to profile columns so that you know which columns have the valuable data that you‚Äôre seeking for deeper analytics.

value.title: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 data‚Äã
value.excerpt: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 Data‚Äã

value.title: Introduction to end-to-end analytics using Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Discover how Microsoft Fabric can meet your enterprise's analytics needs in one platform. Discover the capabilities Fabric has to offer, understand how it works, and identify how you can use Fabric for your analytics needs.

value.title: Work with Delta Lake tables in Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Tables in a Microsoft Fabric lakehouse are based on the Delta Lake technology commonly used in Apache Spark. By using the enhanced capabilities of delta tables, you can create advanced analytics solutions.

value.title: #41 Understanding relationships in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: You normally build relationships in Power BI (connect two tables together) so you can work with the data in both tables as if they were a single table.  In this video you will learn how to create relationships, understand what and how to use the advance options and troubleshoot the most common problems.
